subject: Wimbledon Tennis Tournament
Tennis
Records and Achievements
lead_paragraph: Roger Federer’s 4-6, 7-5, 6-3, 6-4 victory tied the men’s record shared by William Renshaw and Pete Sampras and denied Britain its first men’s singles champion since Fred Perry in 1936.
snippet: Roger Federer’s 4-6, 7-5, 6-3, 6-4 victory tied the men’s record shared by William Renshaw and Pete Sampras and denied Britain its first men’s singles champion since Fred Perry in 1936.
